intro: Maytenus mossambicensis var. stolzii, commonly known as the Stolzii mayten, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange to red fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal and inland regions of South Africa. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
